author: typopo_80

comments.content: 1 looks like some sort of Helvetica - Helvetica Neue 35 Thin I think.
I wonder what a sytem is?

And number 1 is missing the second “s” in the word “system”...

Helvetica Light?
WHOOPS! That’s hilarious. I just saw a book called Setting Your Elgant Table. Maybe they have a sytem for that.

\> <cite>And number 1 is missing the second “s” in the word “system”…</cite>

…and crap kerning. An attractive specimen all round.

Hilarious. #4 is my own photo, which I captioned specifically with the font ID on Flickr. [Vista Sans](http://web.archive.org/web/20070922000740/http:/www.flickr.com/photos/stewf/155830862/). Still confused about your methods, typo. Why not use bookmarks or del.icio.us rather than downloading images and loosing all their info?

I think he/she is taking the p\*ss a tad.

[http://typophile.com/node/31201](http://web.archive.org/web/20070922000740/http:/typophile.com/node/31201)

[http://typophile.com/node/31215](http://web.archive.org/web/20070922000740/http:/typophile.com/node/31215)

Thanks all:)  
Stephen: I surf around made screenshots of ineresting typefaces and lost info where I got them from. I’ll do that what you just recommended.

Typopo, do you TRY to ID them yourself before coming here? See the FAQ - “Where can I do my own research?”

It’s kind of a lot of work (altho we do enjoy it) just to satisfy your curiosity.
I did research using some website, but I couldnt figure it out:( that’s why I’m here..I know its an easy way out but I really do appreciate for the people who help me learn more:(

_Typopo, do you TRY to ID them yourself before coming here? See the FAQ - “Where can I do my own research?”_

Stephen, see my answer under typopo’s other post.
